intro: Bancalus canescens, commonly known as the hairy longhorned beetle, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Cerambycidae. It is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive hairy covering, which provides camouflage in its natural habitat. The plant associated with this beetle is the tree species *Pseudolarix amabilis*, also known as the golden larch. The larvae of *Bancalus canescens* feed on the bark and wood of this conifer, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems. This beetle is primarily found in regions of East Asia, including China and Japan.
